sections.purpose: To provide a flat heating surface for beakers, flasks, and containers.
sections.scope: Applicable to general heating in Pharmaceutical Chemistry.
procedure: Ensure the hot plate surface is clean and free from chemical residues.
Place the container on the center of the heating surface.
Plug the unit into a grounded outlet and turn ON the power switch.
Adjust the temperature dial to the required setting.
Monitor the temperature of the liquid using a thermometer.
Turn OFF the heat and unplug the unit when the task is complete.
Wait for the surface to cool completely before cleaning.
Mark the hot plate with a 'HOT' sign until it is safe to touch.
precautions: Do not use a hot plate near flammable liquids or vapors.
Avoid placing plastic containers or low-boiling solvents directly on the surface.
Ensure the electrical cord does not touch the hot heating surface.
Never leave a hot plate unattended while it is heating.
Check for signs of corrosion or cracked ceramic tops regularly.
